newsitem.title: JAPAN: Tokyo rubber futures end higher on short-covering.
newsitem.headline: Tokyo rubber futures end higher on short-covering.

text.p: Tokyo rubber futures rebounded from early lows to end higher across the board on Friday, lifted by private investors' short-covering, traders said.
Prices ranged from 0.5 yen to 1.7 yen per kg higher. Benchmark April was 0.7 yen higher at 141.6 yen.

Traders said a perception the market was oversold after recent falls spurred sporadic short-covering, but otherwise activity was lacklustre amid a lack of fresh incentives. "Local investors' focus is shifting to more volatile cotton futures market," one trader said.
